title: Seitan and Mushroom Bourguignon with the Boxer
directions: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
Add the bacon, and stir until cooked, about 2 minutes.
Toss the seitan with the flour, salt, and pepper and add to the saucepan.
Cook until the seitan is browned, about 5 minutes, stirring to cook all sides.
Stir in the onion, pepper, carrots, mushrooms, and garlic.
Add the brandy to deglaze the pan and cook about 3 minutes.
Add the wine, broth, tomato paste, and bay leaf.
Partially cover and decrease the heat to low. Simmer about 30 minutes.
Heat the remaining tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the mushrooms and cook about 4 minutes, until they start to release their juices.
Add the mushrooms and any juice to the sauce pan and cook 5 minutes. Remove the bay leaf and serve.
ingredients: 4 slices Light Life Smart Bacon, chopped
12 ounces seitan, cut into bite-sized pieces (Learn how to make seitan at home by followingÂ this recipe)
3 carrots, peeled, cut into 1-inch pieces on the diagonal
1/2 ounce dried porcini mushrooms, rehydrated (see note)
1 cup dry red wine (Rhone or Pinot Noir)
1 cup vegetable broth, more if needed
